raw_comment:
LIzzy,Carter,Anna & Kas
What do we notice
it doesn't matter what their current state it , a lot of them are hopeful. Younger groups are very optimistic,older groups not so much
What do we wonder?
What's up with indonesia? What is going through their minds?Why is there such a big difference between the hopefulness of these countries? Why is there a difference between ages?Why are the european countries all gathered around 50%
What impact does this topic have on you and your community?
We are more optimistic. The world isn't all bad. We wants good things to come for generations after us
Whatâ€™s going on here? Write a catchy headline that captures the graph's main idea.
Our catchy headline we would give it is:

ace_sentences: For many groups, the current state does not matter.
Older groups are not very optimistic.
The authors wonder what Indonesian people think.
The authors wonder why there is a big difference in hopefulness between countries.
The authors wonder why there is a difference in hopefulness between age groups.
Some European countries are around 50 percent.
The authors wonder why the European countries are around 50 percent.
The authors think that the world is not all bad.
The authors want good things to happen for future generations.
The headline is: "Is Gen. Z too happy?"
